metadata.title: CVE-2022-41723 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumptionin the HPACK decoder, sufficient to cause a denial of service from a smallnumber of small requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

google-guest-agent - 20231004.02-0ubuntu1~22.04.3
No subscription required

golang-1.20 - 1.20.1-1
golang-1.20-go - 1.20.1-1
golang-1.20-src - 1.20.1-1
No subscription required

golang-1.21 - 1.20.1-1
golang-1.21-go - 1.20.1-1
golang-1.21-src - 1.20.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-golang-x-net package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
google-guest-agent package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20231004.02-0ubuntu1~22.04.3').
golang-1.13 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.17 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.18 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.20 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.20.1-1').
